_header: Glory unto God laud and benison / To John to Peter
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 466.7.
Title(s): The Pain and Sorrow of Evil Marriage
_description: The Pain and Sorrow of Evil Marriage — twenty-two stanzas rhyme royal

BodDig181.First Lines:
Glory vnto god laude and benysonTo Iohn to Petir & also to
                    laurence…
BodDig181.Last Lines:
…Wherfore yonge men to eschewe sorowe & careWithdrawe your
                    foot or ye ffall in the snare
BodDig181.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             The Latin Poems Commonly Attributed to Walter Mapes.
Camden Society
         o.s. 16 (1841): 295-9 (with 7 additional stanzas from 
            Lydgate, John, trans., The Payne and Sorowe of Evyll Maryage, de Worde, [c.
            1530]).
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 456-60 (17 stanzas; composite text).

CULFf16.First Lines:
Take hede and lern lytull chyld and seeThat tyme passyd wull not a
                    yen retorne…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…O labore passeth ther comyth a noþer newAnd euery day
                    she beginneth batayle
CULFf16.Note: Nine stanzas plus 3 lines of next stanza only.
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 456-60 (17 stanzas; composite text).

BLHar2251.First Lines:
After this story tellith alsoIn confirmatioun of wymmens
                    fragilite…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…By aventure at even or amoroweIn faith the cely husbond shal
                    have al the sorwe
BLHar2251.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 456-60 (17 stanzas; composite text).
